channel.title: A2b3 on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in A2b3 on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: a2b3 lunch non-summary for 3d week of January 2016
item.description: Thanks to everyone for coming to lunch. We had 16 people, and complete introductions in 23 minutes. The topic of the question was “repair”. Linda Diane Feldt is repairing her side door, original equipment on a 90 y/o house. Kathryn Sanderson darns socks. Dan Friedus wants to know if you want to repair his 1980s Bolens garden tractors. (Make an offer.) Ruthann Nichols teaches Science and Wine as a freshman seminar at the U.

item.title: a2b3 lunch non-summary for January 10, 2013; Michigan Terminal System, miniaturized
item.description: I organize lunch every week on Thursdays at Eastern Accents in downtown Ann Arbor. About 400 people get some kind of invitation, and attendance varies from 6 to 25+. (One week we filled the restaurant, which was just a little bit scary.) This week's crowd was good - I counted 18 seats - and the question of the week was asking people to talk about the job they had in college.
